channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - kotaku_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for kotaku_com

item.title: Red Dead Redemption Looks Like It’s Coming To Modern Consoles To Fill The Void Left By GTA 6′s Delay
item.content:encoded:
The first Red Dead Redemption seems to be anything but dead based on a recent rating by the folks over at the ESRB. As one of those iconic open-world games of the Xbox 360 era, that’s good news for those who remember it fondly and those of us who stubbornly still haven’t gotten around to playing it.

With an M-rating indicating all the messy blood and gore a Rockstar game typically comes with (h/t Eurogamer), the filing indicates the presence of zombified action as well, so it seems natural to expect Red Dead’s popular Undead Nightmare expansion to be included:

This is an open-world action-adventure game in which players assume the role of a reformed criminal capturing the remnants of an outlaw gang and combatting a zombie plague.

The first Red Dead Redemption received Switch and PS4 versions in 2023, and a PC release a year later, though it did not come to Xbox Series consoles.

The game’s highly praised sequel, arguably more available due to its backwards compatibility of modern consoles and the 2019 PC release, has also been slow to receive any kind of major graphical update in the way Grand Theft Auto V did only two years following its premiere on PS3 and Xbox 360. Then again, RDR2 is still a visual treat several years after its release, while its predecessor is certainly long in the tooth by now.



https://kotaku.com/red-dead-redemption-remaster-ps5-xbox-series-switch-2-2000644016

item.title: LEGO Harry Potter Advent Calendar Lets You Grab Mini Figures for Peanuts, Wizarding Fans Are Clearing Shelves
item.content:encoded:
Advent calendars are a great way to build anticipation for the holidays, and they are just a lot more fun when each door unlocks your favorite characters or builds. The latest LEGO Harry Potter Advent Calendar is a great way to bring some important elements of the Wizarding World to your place while counting down to Christmas.

This set typically retails for $45, which is already affordable considering all the pieces you’re getting, but you can grab it for even less today. Amazon is currently offering a nice 17% off the calendar, which brings the price down to just $38. The deal is open to both Prime and non-Prime members. You don’t need to worry about entering any coupon codes or following complicated checkout processes to get the discount. Simply add it to your cart, and it will apply automatically. It’s a great time to surprise young Harry Potter fans out there, and maybe even grab two if you’ve got more than one, and you’re not looking to start the Battle of Hogwarts in your living room.

See at Amazon

All the Popular HP Characters and Magical Creatures Right On Your Shelf

This calendar is made for ages 7 and up. It comes with a total of 278 pieces, which come together to create 24 fun surprises. You’ll find all the important characters from the movies – Harry Potter, Cho Chang, Draco Malfoy, Hannah Abbott, Angelina Johnson, Luna Lovegood, Blaise Zabini, and Cedric Diggory – dressed up all fancy (a little unusual) in their cute Christmas sweaters. All the characters have their respective wands to complete the look.

There are also six magical creatures waiting to be discovered. These include Hedwig, Buckbeak, Aragog, a Thestral, a Mandrake, and the Stag Patronus. The creatures have posable wings and legs, so they’re great for display and ready to jump into action when it’s showtime. You will also be building some iconic items like a Hogwarts letter, butterbeer, Bertie Bott’s Every-Flavour Beans, the Sorting Hat, the Chocolate Frog, and the Monster Book of Monsters.

The set comes with a detailed instruction book that takes you step-by-step through each day’s build. It’s also compatible with the LEGO Builder app, which provides 3D instructions, zoom tools, progress reports, etc.

Altogether, it’s great for kids of all ages. Whether you’re little ones are just learning about the Chamber of Secrets or already are big fans of the Wizarding World, this set is sure to add a little holiday magic to their days.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/lego-harry-potter-advent-calendar-lets-you-grab-mini-figures-for-peanuts-wizarding-fans-are-clearing-shelves-2000643590

item.title: Gaming Chair Is Selling for Pennies, Amazon Drops 4.5-Rated Comfort Model to Record Low
item.content:encoded:
Long gaming sessions or workdays at your desk lead to back pain, neck strain and overall discomfort that ruins your focus and enjoyment. Right now, the N-Gen gaming chair costs less than most standard office chairs you’d find at furniture stores which makes zero sense when you compare the features.

Amazon dropped this early Black Friday deal to $99, down from $139, which marks a record low for a chair with a 4.5 star rating from over 1,600 buyers. This pricing puts ergonomic support, adjustable comfort and durable construction within reach of anyone who spends serious time at a desk.

See at Amazon

Ergonomic Features That Prevent Pain

The high-back racing design supports you from your tailbone right up to your shoulders and caters to the full length of your spine, rather than just one section. That comprehensive coverage is important because when you slouch in those unsupported chairs, it creates a domino effect, or ripple, of posture problems originating in your lower back and radiating upward. When seated for prolonged periods, the removable headrest cushions your neck to avoid the forward head posture that causes tension headaches and shoulder pain. A lower back pillow targets the lumbar region where most people have chronic discomfort from sitting, with the curve support that keeps your spine naturally aligned.

The pull-out footrest turns the chair into a reclining station where you can take breaks without leaving your setup. You can lean back during loading screens, between work calls or when you just need to let your eyes rest and stretch. This integrated footrest eliminates the need for an additional ottoman or footstool, freeing up space while giving you the option of bringing your legs up and improving circulation.

High-density foam cushions keep their shape and support over months and years of daily use. Cheap chairs flatten out in no time and you end up sitting on a barely padded surface that feels just about like a wooden bench. The breathable PU leather covering remains comfortable against your skin without the sticky feeling that develops with lower-quality materials on hot days or during long sessions of gaming.

Adjustable comfort comes through multiple mechanisms that let you customize the chair to your body: The recline function with linkage armrests means the armrests move with you when you lean back, maintaining proper arm support in any position. Height adjustment uses an SGS-certified gas lift rated to support up to 300 pounds safely, and gives you confidence that the mechanism won’t fail suddenly and drop you to the floor. The 360-degree swivel and smooth-rolling wheels let you pivot between monitors, reach for items or move around your space.

Assembly usually takes about 20 to 30 minutes with basic tools and is simple enough which means you won’t require any pro help. The chair comes complete with all the hardware you’ll need, along with clear instructions on attaching the base, mounting the seat, installing the backrest, and connecting the armrests. Once assembled, the chair feels solid and substantial rather than rickety or questionable like self-assembly furniture sometimes does.

At $99, you’re paying less than basic office chairs from big box stores while getting adjustable features, ergonomic support, and build quality that typically costs $200 or more.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/gaming-chair-is-selling-for-pennies-amazon-drops-4-5-rated-comfort-model-to-record-low-2000643991

item.title: JBL Charge 6 Bluetooth Speaker Is Practically Free, an All-Time Low You’ll Only See for Early Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
Good music can bring life to any party, but not all speakers are made equal. If you’re after something that’s portable enough to travel with and powerful enough to fill any room with rich sound, JBL’s Charge 6 Bluetooth speaker is a great option to consider.

On a regular day, it would run you around $200, which we won’t exactly label a budget buy. But right now, Amazon has it marked down to just $130, thanks to a nice 35% early Black Friday discount. The deal is available on all color options. Prefer your audio gear with a classic look? Consider the classic Black option. Want your speaker to have a bit more personality? The cool Squad version is up for grabs, too. Of course, like all massive discounts, we’re not expecting this one to stick around for long. We’re also not sure if it will be back for Black Friday, so it’s best to take advantage of it while you can!

See at Amazon

Sound That Fills Any Room

The size is compact, and it comes with a removable strap, which makes it quite convenient to carry it with you on the go. Redesigned hardware and JBL AI Sound Boost come together to deliver deeper bass, better highs, and clear lows without any distortion. It’s enough to fill any room with your favorite tracks, whether you’re listening to something energy-filled or winding down with some relaxing music after a long day.

The Charge 6 is more than enough to get the vibe going on its own, but if you’re after bigger sound, Auracast lets you link up other JBL speakers for bigger, wider coverage. Just ask your friends to bring theirs, and keep the party going all night long.

Battery is just as impressive. You’re looking at around 24 hours of playtime on a single charge, which easily translates into around two days of fun. If you need some extra juice and cannot plug it in, JBL Playtime Boost gives you an extra four hours of jamming. Charge 6 is also rated IP68 waterproof and dustproof, plus can survive 1-meter drops onto concrete. Take it to your off-road adventures, on the beach, by the pool, and even in the shower for a private concert without a worry.

All in all, this speaker not only offers great sound, but also easy portability, durability, and a long battery life that keeps the fun going.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/boost-your-audio-experience-by-grabbing-the-jbl-charge-6-for-less-than-150-2000643582

item.title: Lies Of P Company Is Somehow Making 5 Games And Only One Of Them Is The Sequel
item.content:encoded:
In a growing field of copycat Soulslikes, Lies of P stands apart as one of the best. This year’s Overture DLC proved the game wasn’t a fluke. Now, the publisher behind the Pinocchio-punk action-RPG has confirmed it has a whopping five games currently in various stages of development, and only one of them is Lies of P 2.

The South Korean mobile gaming giant Neowiz’s upcoming slate was outlined in its latest earnings report as part of a multi-phase plan. The first phase revolves around a handful of new mobile games and published projects coming next year. The second phase is much more ambitious and outlines several PC and console projects from different genres aimed at driving “global expansion.” Here’s how they’re listed:

  • Life Simulation New Project – Life Simulation – PC/Console
  • Survival Action Adventure New Project – Survival Action Adventure – PC/Console
  • Lies of P Sequel – Souls-like RPG – PC/Console
  • New Project by Seungho Jin – Narrative-based RPG – PC/Console
  • New Project by Kay Lee – Souls-like RPG – PC/Console

The life sim and survival action games seem pretty self-explanatory. Seungho Jin directed the anime-style visual novel Buried Stars, though it sounds like his new game will push more into RPG territory. Maybe something in the vein of a turn-based Atlus game? Lies of P was made by in-house subsidiary Game8. It’s unclear if they’ll be involved in this second Soulslike RPG or if Kay Lee will be leading a completely separate team.

Hopefully, most of these projects comes out and at least some of them are good. It’s interesting to see more South Korea-based publishers and developers move into bigger, single-player PC and console releases. It suggests the success of games like Lies of P and Stellar Blade has proven there are lucrative opportunities outside of free-to-play grinds and gacha casinos. Though it’ll probably be several years yet before we see the next wave.



https://kotaku.com/lies-p-2-sequel-soulslike-rpg-neowiz-2000643986

item.title: Forget MacBook, HP Drops 17.3″ Windows 11 Pro Laptop by 71% Just Before the Holiday Rush (32GB RAM, 1TB SSD)
item.content:encoded:
It’s not every day you get to snag a fully loaded 17-inch laptop with serious muscle for less, and that’s especially true for options from known brands out there. While we’re still a couple of weeks away from Black Friday, deals on top-rated tech are coming in hot already, which makes it a great time to treat yourself to a new, powerful laptop that you can use for both work and play.

Amazon is currently being generous with a massive 71% discount on the 17.3-inch HP laptop, which brings it price down to $700. This machine is packed with high-end specs, so finding it at an entry-level price like this is a rare win, and you’re even getting a bunch of useful accessories thrown in for absolutely free. It’s also one of the lowest prices we have ever seen this powerhouse drop to, and the deal is open to both Prime and non-Prime members. We just recommend getting your orders in fast, as the offer might wrap up any moment now.

See at Amazon

Immersive Visuals, Comfortable Typing Experience

It’s a sleek laptop with a basic, no-fuss design. The build feels premium, and is also quite lightweight for you to carry around easily. The screen size is quite generous. For context, most options in this range offer a 15.6-inch display, so you’ve got significantly more room to work, browse, and stream here. You’ll enjoy crisp, bright visuals thanks to its HD+ IPS panel, and since it’s anti-glare, you won’t have to deal with annoying reflections when working in brighter settings.

Then there’s a full-sized keyboard with a lift-hinge design, which gently elevates your typing angle just a bit to ensure a comfortable position. Those who spend long hours typing won’t have to deal with sore wrists by the end of it.

Performance-wise, you’re covered with an Intel i3-N305 processor with 8 cores, reaching speeds up to 3.8GHz, plus a massive 32GB of DDR4 RAM. That’s enough power to push through a variety of tasks and even multitask during busy days without slowing down. For storage, you get a fast 1TB PCIe SSD. It’s got enough room to store all your important data without constantly needing an external drive.

Wi-Fi 6 and Bluetooth 5.4 make wireless connectivity easy, and you’re getting a wide range of ports to connect peripherals without feeling limited. There’s a lot more to like about this laptop, especially now that it’s down to $700. Just be sure to grab yours fast, before the price shoots back up.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/forget-macbook-hp-drops-17-3-windows-11-pro-laptop-by-71-just-before-the-holiday-rush-32gb-ram-1tb-ssd-2000643579

item.title: Hideo Kojima And Disney Plus Reveal Death Stranding Isolations
item.content:encoded:
We already knew Hideo Kojima was working on an anime movie set in the Death Stranding universe, Death Stranding: Mosquito, and he’d also dropped word that there were other Death Stranding-based adaptions in the works. Well, now we know what at least one of them is going to be: Death Stranding Isolations, an anime TV series created for Disney Plus.

Kojima’s number-one fan, Geoff Keighley, posted the news to his Game Awards account, stating that the seemingly very brightly-colored series would be arriving from Kojima Productions and E&H Productions on Disney’s streamer some time in 2027.

Death Stranding Isolations has been announced, a new anime series coming to Disney+ in 2027, from the mind of Hideo Kojima. pic.twitter.com/gY65pFFWkh

— The Game Awards (@thegameawards) November 13, 2025

Deadline, meanwhile, has a few more details about the project, revealing that the series will be directed by Dragon Ball Z: Battle of Gods‘ Takayuki Sano, and stresses it will be using traditional hand-drawn 2D animation (which is presumably now how we say, “God, no, it’s not using AI.”) It will star the series’ main character, Sam Bridges, in a spin-off story where Bridges is attempting to save America and help others cope in their isolation. The summary continues,

“An old man is trying to realize salvation through ways outside of the connection advocated by Bridges. A female warrior is trying to kickstart a world of constant fighting. A boy holds a grudge against Bridges, and a girl has embraced her loneliness. On the precipice of the end of humanity and the world, their fates and hopes converge, as another story of Death Stranding begins.”

There’s no word on casting yet, although it would be surely impossible for anyone other than Norman Reedus to voice Bridges. It’s interesting to note that the promotional image doesn’t show him, however, instead presumably focusing on that younger boy and girl mentioned in the blurb. It seems likely that the anime will explore the lives of the individuals Bridges meets on his wobbly journeys, as he helps them reconnect. And hopefully it’ll all be super-fucking weird.

Obviously this is still a long way off—given there’s no specific portion of 2027 mentioned, it could be as much as two years before we get to see any of it. But, unlike Mosquito, at least this seems to be showing some sort of plan for when to actually exist.



https://kotaku.com/hideo-kojima-death-stranding-isolations-disney-plus-2000643968

item.title: Funko Pop Practically Gives Away Pokémon Advent Calendar to Clear Out Remaining Stock Before Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
Are those sleigh bells I hear? No, sir. Those are Pokéballs. December is approaching faster than a Blaziken’s Quick Attack. With the holidays right around the corner, why not have some extra fun counting down to Christmas this year? You and your family can celebrate the beginning of the holiday season with this advent calendar from Funko Pop. This set is packed with daily surprises in the form of mini Funko Pop vinyl figures of a handful of your favorite Pokémon. Amazon usually lists the mystery box holiday calendar for $50, but ahead of Black Friday, the site has it going for 10% off. That saves you a cool $5, bringing the price to just $45 for a limited time.

See at Amazon

Celebrate With Your Favorite Pokémon, One Day at a Time

This makes an ideal gift for Pokémon fans of all ages. Just get it to them before December, otherwise that kind of defeats the purpose of an advent calendar. How it works is the mystery box contains four rows of six small doors, each containing a beloved Pokémon character. Starting on December 1, you can peel back the layer to reveal who it is behind it waiting in vinyl Funko Pop form. One day, you’ll find Caterpie, the next you might Bulbasaur, then after that maybe Piplup. Every day for 25 days, you get to reveal a new pocket-sized friend.

All Pokémon included are featured right on the box. If you want to keep yourself surprised, I suggest you neither not look at it too closely nor read the following list, detailing each of the 24 Funko Pop Pokémon included:

  • Caterpie
  • Sylveon
  • Dragonite
  • Oshawott
  • Arcanine
  • Lucario
  • Pigeotto
  • Leafeon
  • Horsea
  • Ponyta
  • Umbreon
  • Lapras
  • Munchlax
  • Psyduck
  • Charmander
  • Squirtle
  • Charizard
  • Alakazam
  • Scorbunny
  • Lapras
  • Espeon
  • Eevee
  • Pikachu
  • Bulbasaur

Predictably, most featured are Gen 1 though there are some later generation favorites getting some love too. 16 are among the first Pokémon we met on our Game Boys back in 1999 while the other nine comprise of mainly later generation starters and various new Eeveelutions.

Each figure is smaller than the standard, popular Funko Pop figures. They measure in individually at a maximum of two inches tall. They are made from a durable vinyl materials. As collectibles, these are built to last—able to withstand daily wear of playtime too.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/funko-pop-practically-gives-away-pokemon-advent-calendar-to-clear-out-remaining-stock-before-black-friday-2000643653
